author: palmbeachpost
title: Best Bets
text:
DELRAY BEACH
“Sayonara” to Sushi & Stroll
Friday is your last chance to sip sake at the Morikami Museum. The Morikami Museum and Japanese Gardens will hold its last Sushi & Stroll of the season on Friday from 5:30 to 8:30 p.m. Explore the gardens, cold drink in hand. Sip various craft sake selections — sweet, sparkling, creamy, in a can. In addition, take in a roaring taiko drum performance by Fushu Daiko at 6:30, 7:15 and 8 p.m. (additional $2, limited tickets available.) $8, adults (11 and up), $6, children (4-10), free for museum members and children 3 and under. Admission to Morikami: $15, adults; $9, children (6-17); free, 5 and under; $13, seniors and military. 4000 Morikami Park Road. 561-495-0233; www.morikami.org
JUPITER
Live music on the water
Tom Jackson and his band will play Friday in Jupiter. Harbourside Place offers free concerts on Friday nights. This Friday, hear the Tom Jackson Band, playing driving, aggressive country music, from 6 to 10 p.m. at the Waterfront Amphitheater. 200 N. U.S. 1. www.harboursideplace.com
WEST PALM BEACH
On Friday at 8 p.m., watch “Tangled” (rated PG), part of West Palm Beach’s Screen on the Green series (second Friday of each month). Baby Princess Rapunzel is kidnapped and held inside a tower. But years later, charming bandit Flynn Ryder scales the tower and is taken captive by Rapunzel. She strikes a deal with the thief to escape. Free. Downtown, at Waterfront Commons. www.wpb.org/screen
Learn history while strolling
Take the Historic Northwood Art Walk on Saturday and learn about the neighborhood’s background. Two guided tours (1.5 hours each) are available: 6 p.m. and 7:30. You’ll hear about the history of Northwood Village and then visit the vibrant art district, with its mix of galleries, boutiques and restaurants. Sip wine and enjoy light appetizers while artists present demonstrations and lectures. Art Walks occur the second Saturday of each month. Free, but reservations required. Space is limited to 20 people. Starts at 540 Northwood Road. 561-506-4108; www.northwoodartwalk.com
</span
